text: Slice a binary number into groups of five digits
Is there any neat trick to slice a binary number into groups of five digits in python?

Edit:
I want to write a cipher/encoder in order to generate "easy to read over the phone" tokens.
The standard base32 encoding has the following disadvantages:

lis.text: Uses confusing chars like chars like 'I', 'L', 'O' (may be confused with 0 and 1)

text: I was able to roll my own in 20 lines of python, thanks everybody.
My encoder leaves off 'I', 'L', 'O' and 'U', and the resulting sequences are hard to guess.
